title: Shock Manchester City reports: Secret deal for Barcelona star Ivan Rakitic close
text:
1 of 6 Gabriel Jesus has arrived at Manchester Airport after his Â£27m move from Palmeiras 
According to the claims, both parties are keeping the deal a secret until the terms can be ironed out. 
Rakitic, 28, has played 21 games for Barcelona this season - although he has started just three games since the start of December. 
Rakitic has struggled to convince Barca manager Luis Enrique that he deserves a regular starting place in the XI, with the boss willing to play Denis Suarez and Andre Gomes ahead of the former Seville star. GETTY Manchester City reportedly want to sign Barcelona midfielder Ivan Rakitic GETTY Barcelona are supposedly close to agreeing a deal for Rakitic to leave 
However, Enrique insists he doesn't want the midfielder to leave. 
When asked about Rakitic's future, Enrique said: "It's up to me to decide the squads and the teams. That's my job. 
"What's been published has nothing to do with that. 
"Only 25 per cent of things are true, be it in the Croatian, Spanish, English or Italian media." GETTY Rakitic (left) has started just three games for Barcelona since the end of November 
Were Rakitic to leave Barca, Enrique would likely look to bring in a new midfielder, what with Sergio Busquets also tipped to quit the club at the end of the season. 
It is claimed the Chinese Super League are also sniffing around Rakitic, who could greatly increase his current wages by swapping the Nou Camp for the Far East. 
Jurtanji report that fellow Croatia team members Marcelo Brozovic and Nikola Kalinic may also be tempted by moves to China before the transfer window closes. Related articles
